Job Title: Executive Director of Advanced Analytics (Clinical Technology)

Location: Durham, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
As a leading global contract research organization (CRO) with a passion for scientific rigor and decades of clinical development experience, Fortrea provides pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device customers a wide range of clinical development, patient access and technology solutions across more than 20 therapeutic areas. With over 19,000 staff conducting operations in more than 90 countries, Fortrea is transforming drug and device development for partners and patients across the globe.

Are you ready to redefine what’s possible, and discover your extraordinary potential at Fortrea?

The Executive Director, Advanced Analytics is responsible for driving and overseeing the strategy and implementation of advanced analytics within the Clinical Platforms Technology organization.

This role involves leading initiatives that harness advanced statistical techniques, data analysis and predictive modeling to gain insights from data and drive business solutions. Success in this position is measured by the efficacy, scalability, and impact of analytics initiatives.

Fortrea is a company dedicated to the idea that people at all levels of our organization should reflect the communities we serve. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are more than just concepts; they are woven into our DNA. We believe in cultivating a workspace where all employees can thrive.

Our mission is to help our clients bring the miracles of medicine to market sooner -- join us for your next career move.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Oversee and drive the strategic direction of Clinical Platforms advanced analytics function.Lead a team of analytics professionals, setting objectives and shaping department strategies.Coordinate with the AI/ML Rapid Development Studio to further develop AI/ML prototypes.Develop and implement advanced statistical techniques, data mining and predictive models to gain insights from data and create business solutions.Partner with other senior leaders to understand their data needs and determine how data can be used strategically to achieve Fortrea business goals.Manage a diverse portfolio of projects, prioritizing them based on the objectives of the Clinical Platforms organization.Keep up to date with the latest technologies and trends in analytics, AI, and machine learning and incorporate these into business strategy.Ensure integrity, confidentiality, and appropriate use of data in accordance with regulations and standards.Foster a data-driven culture across the organization, championing the use of data in decision-making processes.Act as a liaison between the analytics team and other departments to synchronize efforts and ensure transparent and effective communication.And all other duties as needed or assigned.


Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.Fortrea may consider relevant and equivalent experience in lieu of educational requirements.


Experience (Minimum Required): 

Minimum of 10 years of experience in a role focusing on developing data analytics or statistics capabilities.At least 5 years of experience in a leadership role required.Strong knowledge of advanced statistical methods, predictive modeling, machine learning algorithms, and artificial intelligence.Experience with data analysis software (R, Python, SAS, SQL), visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI), and big data platforms (Hadoop, Spark).Proficiency in advanced analytics techniques such as data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.Ability to critically think and solve complex business problems using data.Strong communication skills to interpret and explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.Proven track record of managing large technical teams and delivering complex, data-driven solutions.


Preferred Qualifications Include:

Master’s degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.Certifications in analytics, engineering, or big data.Experience in a CRO or healthcare-related industry.Strong project management and organizational skills.


Fortrea is looking for problem-solvers and creative thinkers who are passionate about breaking down barriers faced by sponsors of clinical trials, and who are committed to helping transform the development process to get promising life-changing ideas and therapies to patients faster. Join us as we cultivate a workspace where all employees have the opportunity to grow and make impacts on a global scale.

For more information about Fortrea, visit www.fortrea.com.

Pay Range: $160K - $280K (The range does not include benefits, and if applicable, bonus, commission, or equity)

Benefits: All job offers will be based on a candidate’s skills and prior relevant experience, applicable degrees/certifications, as well as internal equity and market data. Regular, full-time or part-time employees working 20 or more hours per week are eligible for comprehensive benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, STD/LTD, 401(K), ESPP, Paid time off (PTO) or Flexible time off (FTO), and Company bonus where applicable.

Fortrea is actively seeking motivated problem-solvers and creative thinkers who share our passion for overcoming barriers in clinical trials. Our unwavering commitment is to revolutionize the development process, ensuring the swift delivery of life-changing ideas and therapies to patients in need. Join our exceptional team and embrace a collaborative workspace where personal growth is nurtured, enabling you to make a meaningful global impact. For more information about Fortrea, visit www.fortrea.com.

Fortrea is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:

As an EOE/AA employer, Fortrea strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our Privacy Statement.

Experience Level (if available): Director
